metadata.title: CVE-2013-1922 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
qemu-nbd in QEMU, as used in Xen 4.2.x, determines the format of a raw diskimage based on the header, which allows local guest OS administrators toread arbitrary files on the host by modifying the header to identify adifferent format, which is used when the guest is restarted, a differentvulnerability than CVE-2008-2004.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-block-extra - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-guest-agent - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-kvm - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-arm - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-common - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-mips - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-misc - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-ppc - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-s390x - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-sparc - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-x86 - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-static - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-utils - 1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.0+dfsg-3ubuntu2').
